result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Ryan D. Sisco
Current: Homeless, Rhinelander, WI 54501 United States  (Effective: 02-03-2022)
Prior: 2835 Hancock Lake Rd, Harshaw, WI 54529

1:26 PM Defendant Ryan D. Sisco appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek in court for Ryan D. Sisco.  Attorney Michael Schiek in court for State of Wisconsin. Counsel in receipt of complaint. Court quashes warrant in all cases. Calling 21CM232, 22CF134, 21CF338, 22CF29. Schiek speaks to bond - requests $500 cash bond in all cases. Svehlek requests signature bonds on all cases; requests preliminary hearing. Court statement-set cash bond of $250 on each case. Svehlek enters not guilty plea in 22CF134.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.
per Scott @ ONSO - in custody - ONSO

1:45 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Ryan D. Sisco not in court. Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek in court for Ryan D. Sisco. Calling 21CF338, 21CM232, 22CF29 & 22CF134. Svehlek states she does not know the whereabouts of Defendant - not able to contact - has no current phone number. Court authorizes warrant. adj. 01:46 PM

2:51 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ryan D. Sisco in court.  Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek in court for Ryan D. Sisco. Calling 21CF338, 21CM232 & 22CF29. Pfeifer states cases are not resolved - will have another referral coming. Defendant states he is homeless - starting new employment tomorrow. Pfeifer will reach out to DOC. Defendant states may move in with his mother. Court statement to Defendant reporting his address. Bond continued. adj. 02:54 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt:
09:04 AM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ryan D. Sisco in court.  Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek in court for Ryan D. Sisco. Calling 21CF338, 21CM232 & 22CF29. 21CF338 & 22CF29 set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Schiek states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Svehlek willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Schiek statement to letter concerning bond. Defendant statement to bond. Court removes co-signer from bond. Bond continued. adj. 09:09 AM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Calling 22CF29, 21CF338 & 21CM232. 22CF29 set for an initial appearance and other to cases for a bond hearing. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Court sets bond in 22CF29 and reinstates bond in 21CF338 & 21CM232. . adj. 01:32 PM
